result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cornelius Terrell Harris

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cornelius Terrell Harris appeared by video.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy appeared by video for Cornelius Terrell Harris.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Cornelius Terrell Harris appeared by video.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy in court for Cornelius Terrell Harris.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel was recently appointed and request additional pretrial conference date. Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail pond previously posted to be returned to remitter. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with EMC.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Cornelius Terrell Harris in court.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant advised that this case is re-assigned to Judge Skwierawski, Branch 41.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 41 for a Pretrial Conference.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 9/6/22 @ 1p
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 9-6-2022 @1p
